amendment.description: Amendment expresses the sense of the Congress that the Secretary, State educational agencies, and local educational agencies should work together to ensure that not less than 95 percent of all funds appropriated to carry out elementary and secondary education programs under this Act is spent directly to improve the academic achievement of the Nation's children in their classrooms.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 4 printed in House Report 107-69 to express the sense of the Congress that the Department of Education, states, and local educational agencies work together to ensure that at least 95% of all funds appropriated for elementary and secondary education programs administered by the Department of Education is spent directly to improve the academic achievement of children in classrooms.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Graves amendment Agreed to by recorded vote: 422 - 0 (Roll no. 129).
